00019 #define kOffsetASCII 32
00020 #define kSetA 1
00021 #define kSetB 2
00022 #define kSetC 3
00023 #define kASCII "ascii"
00024 
00025 using namespace std;
00026 using namespace rapidxml;

00044 void Base128::encodeSymbol ( const string *data )
00045 {
00046         string *filename = new string( "Base128.xml" );
00047         xml_document< > parsed_xml;
00048         parsed_xml.parse< 0 >( getXMLToParse( filename ) );
00049         xml_node< > *node = NULL;
00050         xml_node< > *special = NULL;
00051         int offsetASCIIValue;
00052         const string *incomingString = data;
00053         int previousCharSet = kSetA; //** default to using set A first **
00054         
00055         //** make an array of the ascii value of each char in the string **
00056         int stringLength = incomingString->length( );
00057         int asciiList[ stringLength ];
00058         //** loop thru the data and fill the array with its ascii values. **
00059         for ( int ii = 0; ii < stringLength; ii++ ) 
00060         {
00061                 unsigned char eachChar = incomingString->at( ii );
00062                 asciiList[ ii ] = ( int )eachChar;
00063         }
00064         
00065         for ( int jj = 0; jj < stringLength; jj++ ) 
00066         {
00067                 //** concatenate strings to get tag name, a serious hack but couldnt get boost working and itoa is non-standard c++
00068                 string firstBit = kASCII;
00069                 int kk = asciiList[ jj ];
00070                 offsetASCIIValue = kk;
00071                 string secondBit;
00072                 stringstream out;
00073                 out << kk;
00074                 secondBit = out.str( );
00075                 out.flush( );
00076                 firstBit.append( secondBit );
00077                 int charSetToRef = 1;
00078                 string ASCIIRef = kASCII;
00079                 char secondDigit;
00080                 char firstDigit = incomingString->at( jj );
00081                 
00082                 vector<string> returnedData;
00083                 
00084                 // *** C Char Set ***
00085                 if ( ( jj + 1 ) < stringLength ) 
00086                 {
00087                         secondDigit = incomingString->at( jj + 1 );
00088                 }
00089                 
00090                 if ( isdigit( secondDigit ) && isdigit( firstDigit ) ) 
00091                 {
00092                         string setCAscii = ASCIIRef.append( &firstDigit );
00093                         
00094                         string shortString = setCAscii.substr( 5, 2 );
00095                         offsetASCIIValue = std::atoi( shortString.c_str( ) )  + kOffsetASCII;
00096                         
00097                         stringstream out2;
00098                         out2 << offsetASCIIValue;
00099                         ASCIIRef = kASCII;
00100                         ASCIIRef.append( out2.str( ) );
00101                         out2.flush( );
00102                         
00103                         node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "data_encoding" )->first_node( ASCIIRef.c_str( ) );
00104                         returnedData = returnDOMValues( node );
00105                         charSetToRef = kSetC;
00106                         firstDigit = NULL;
00107                         secondDigit = NULL;
00108                         ++jj;
00109                 }
00110                 else //*** A or B Char Sets ***
00111                 {
00112                         node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "data_encoding" )->first_node( firstBit.c_str( ) );
00113                         returnedData = returnDOMValues( node );
00114                         //** Use Set B? **
00115                         string aSetTest = returnedData.at( kSetA );
00116                         string bSetTest = returnedData.at( kSetB );
00117                         if ( aSetTest == "nil" ) 
00118                         {
00119                                 charSetToRef = kSetB;
00120                         }
00121                         //** OK, Set A it is. **
00122                         if ( bSetTest == "nil" )
00123                         {
00124                                 charSetToRef = kSetA;
00125                         }
00126                 }
00127                 
00128                 if ( previousCharSet != charSetToRef ) //** Do we need a code set symbol inserted? **
00129                 {
00130                         //** What was the previous character set? Need it as a letter so we convert **
00131                         string prevCharSetRefAsString;
00132                         switch ( previousCharSet ) 
00133                         {
00134                                 case 1:
00135                                         prevCharSetRefAsString = "A";
00136                                         break;
00137                                 case 2:
00138                                         prevCharSetRefAsString = "B";
00139                                         break;
00140                                 case 3:
00141                                         prevCharSetRefAsString = "C";
00142                                         break;
00143                         }
00144                         
00145                         //** Which char set are we going to? We can shoot to the exact place in the DOM **
00146                         string charSettoRefAsString;
00147                         switch ( charSetToRef ) 
00148                         {
00149                                 case 1:
00150                                         charSettoRefAsString =  "CodeA";
00151                                         checkCharList->push_back( 101 );
00152                                         break;
00153                                 case 2:
00154                                         charSettoRefAsString = "CodeB";
00155                                         checkCharList->push_back( 100 );
00156                                         break;
00157                                 case 3:
00158                                         charSettoRefAsString = "CodeC";
00159                                         checkCharList->push_back( 99 );
00160                                         break;
00161                         }
00162                         
00163                         //** Get the data we need back into a vector
00164                         special = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "non_data_encoding" )->first_node( charSettoRefAsString.c_str( ) )->first_node( prevCharSetRefAsString.c_str( ) );
00165                         
00166                         vector< int > *specialPattern = new vector< int >;
00167                         string receivedPattern = special->value( );
00168                         for ( int mm = 0; mm < receivedPattern.length( ); mm++ ) 
00169                         {
00170                                 char eachCharFromResult = receivedPattern.at( mm );
00171                                 int temp = atoi( &eachCharFromResult );
00172                                 specialPattern->push_back( temp );
00173                         }
00174                         
00175                         // Create and store non-data symbol
00176                         Symbol *bSymbol = createSymbol( 5, 0, 1, 0, specialPattern );
00177                         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( bSymbol );
00178                         
00179                         delete specialPattern;
00180                 }
00181                 
00182                 previousCharSet = charSetToRef;
00183                 
00184                 vector< int > *pattern = new vector< int >;
00185                 for ( int ll = 0; ll < returnedData.at( charSetToRef ).length( ) ; ll++)
00186                 {
00187                         char eachCharFromResult = returnedData.at( charSetToRef )[ ll ];
00188                         int temp = atoi( &eachCharFromResult );
00189                         pattern->push_back( temp );
00190                 }
00191                 
00192                 //fill the vector to prep for the check char work
00193                 switch ( charSetToRef ) 
00194                 {
00195                         case kSetA:
00196                                 if ( offsetASCIIValue >= 0 && offsetASCIIValue <= 31 )
00197                                 {
00198                                         checkCharList->push_back( offsetASCIIValue + 64 );
00199                                 } 
00200                                 else if ( offsetASCIIValue >= 32 && offsetASCIIValue <= 95) 
00201                                 {
00202                                         checkCharList->push_back( offsetASCIIValue - 32 );
00203                                 }
00204                                 break;
00205                         case kSetB:
00206                                 if ( offsetASCIIValue >= 32 && offsetASCIIValue <= 127 )
00207                                 {
00208                                         checkCharList->push_back( offsetASCIIValue - 32 );
00209                                 } 
00210                                 break;
00211                         case kSetC:
00212                                 checkCharList->push_back( offsetASCIIValue - 32 );
00213                                 break;
00214                         default:
00215                                 break;
00216                 }
00217 
00218                 // Create and store data symbol
00219                 Symbol *aSymbol = createSymbol( 0, 0, 1, 0, pattern ); //Default values for Base128 and BaseEANUPC except data
00220                 BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( aSymbol );
00221                 
00222                 delete pattern;
00223         }
00224 }
